description: Dyson Sphere Program is a sci-fi strategy game where you build and manage a factory in space.

v0.0.2.description:
# Changes
This version only has a single bugfix.
## Bugfixes
- Fixed some seeds not being possible due to multi-step tech dependencies being in the wrong AP region
v0.0.2.title: DSP .apworld v0.0.2

v0.0.3.description:
# Changelog
This version fixes a critical bug that made seeds impossible, due to misconfigured progression rules.
v0.0.3.title: v0.0.3 - dsp.apworld

v0.1.0.description:
# Changes
This version makes two important changes:
- The basic mk.1 factory buildings are flagged as early (before blue matrix) progression: assembler, smelter, conveyor belt, sorter, storage
- All upgrades are now marked as EXCLUDED location types, preventing them from holding important progression items

In the future, these changes will be configurable through the YAML. For now, if you don't want this, use the last version (v0.0.3).

Minor version bumped to reflect this added functionality.
v0.1.0.title: v0.1.0 - dsp.apworld

v0.1.1.description:
# Changes
This version adds the basic mining facility as a progression item before blue matrix, ensuring early access to mining.
v0.1.1.title: v0.1.1 - dsp.apworld

v0.2.0rc1.description:
Full rewrite of the generation logic.
The APWorld now correctly considers needed recipes, items and machines for creating matrices and unlocking researches.
This should hopefully prevent softlocks
v0.2.0rc1.title: v0.2.0-rc1

v0.2.0rc2.description:
Add support for progressive upgrades, and make all upgrades progressive for now. This will be part of the yaml in the future.

Requires the DSP_AP mod v0.1.0rc2 available [here](https://github.com/BloodStainedCrow/DSP_AP/releases/tag/v0.1.0rc2).
v0.2.0rc2.title: v0.2.0-rc2

v0.2.0rc3.description:
Added 4 new options to the yaml:
- Goal Tech: Specify which technology is needed for victory
- Max Matrix needed: Limit the game to placing progression items to technologies before a certain matrix level (i.e. <= Yellow matrix)
- Exclude Upgrades: Allow/Disallow progression items to be places in Upgrade technologies
- Use Progressive Upgrades: Reverts to non progressive Upgrades when disabled, currently experimental.
v0.2.0rc3.title: v0.2.0-rc3

v0.2.0rc4.description: FIX: Ensure the flight requirements for silicon and titanium are enforced.
v0.2.0rc4.title: v0.2.0-rc4
